page.title: 12FARMING IN BUNNY
page.content: {Moor End Farm}is a mixed farm it is owned by{Mr.& Mrs. Hind}and their son. The farm has been in the family for four generations. They fatten{cattle and grow{crops.}Their land is in the valley separated by the Fairham Brook. The farm has{200 acres}of land, it consists of clay, loam and good black soil. The fields are spread out and they grow{oil seed rape, wheat and {barley.}They keep a field of grass to make{hay}to feed the cattle.They use nitrogen and compound fertilizer.They have their own combine, tractors and farm machinery. They buy male calves from{Newark and Melton}livestock markets. They keep them in cattle sheds all the time and feed them on a diet of course mix and straw. Three types of beast are reared,{Freisians, {Herefords and Charolais.}When the cattle are fattened they are sold.
